intro: Dymczewiczia elata, commonly known as the slender dymczewiczia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has slender, branched stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a composite head, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes.
